narratives.description:
Technical support assistants are a part of the company's information technology (IT) team. Their primary goals are to offer support and assistance to customers related to computers, technology, desktop support, and data management. They act as a part of the company's help desk and are often the customer's first point of contact when there is a technology support request. Additionally, in some companies, the technical support assistant is also responsible for data archiving, installing software, controlling and maintaining websites and social media, and training employees on new and updated software. Since technology plays a key role in the technical support assistant's job, it is important that they have an excellent technical knowledge and are up-to-date on the latest technology. Since technology is always changing, they must be able to learn and adapt, as well as be able to teach and demonstrate how they work and are best used. 
A high school diploma or equivalent is typically the minimum educational requirement for this position; however, employers may give preference to candidates with relevant postsecondary education. Technical support assistants must have excellent communication skills, be able to work with others and independently, be well organized, be customer service-minded, and have the ability to remain professional in challenging customer service situations.Technical skills are important in this line of work, and technical support assistants must have knowledge of iOS, and Windows operating systems and at least two years of data processing experience. PC repair and computer operations training are often strongly desired.
narratives.summaryHourly: The average pay for a Technical Support Assistant is $18.18 per hour.
narratives.summarySalary: The average pay for a Technical Support Assistant is $53,374 per year.

occupationalDetails.skills: Microsoft Word, Customer Service, Microsoft Office, Systems Troubleshooting, Technical Services, Network Management / Administration, Windows Operating System General Use, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, Help Desk / Desktop Support (Tier 2), Project Management, Computer Hardware Technician
